Wealth Officer Job at Kaplo Africa




        
    

        
        Kaplo Africas - Our client, a reputable and fully licensed Asset Management company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Wealth Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	This role is strictly for professionals with proven experience in registered and licensed asset management firms, given the regulatory sensitivity and compliance standards of the industry.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop and manage high-net-worth and institutional client portfolios
	Drive asset growth through strategic client acquisition and relationship management
	Provide tailored investment advisory services aligned with clients’ financial goals
	Ensure strict adherence to regulatory, compliance, and risk management frameworks
	Collaborate with internal investment and research teams to optimize portfolio performance
	Monitor market trends and proactively position client portfolios


Requirements


	5–7 years of experience in a registered and licensed asset management firm (non-negotiable)
	Strong understanding of capital markets, investment products, and regulatory requirements
	Demonstrated track record of portfolio growth and client retention
	Excellent relationship management and communication skills
	Relevant professional certifications (CIS, CFA, or equivalent) will be an advantage.


Ideal Candidate:


	A strategic thinker with strong regulatory discipline, commercial acumen, and the ability to manage sophisticated investment conversations with high-value clients.
	This is an exceptional opportunity for a results-oriented wealth professional ready to operate at a high-performance level within a structured and compliant investment environment.


Salary
N1,400,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: kaploafrica@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

MIS Executive (Procurement) Job at Paras Energy




        
    

        
        
     

            
    

Paras Energy was incorporated in the year 2002. We are a diversified and internationally recognized energy company that provides stable and reliable power to all customers by generation and distribution of power while maintaining stringent adherence to OEM guidelines of operation and maintenance. Apart from power generation and distribution, we can also provide EPC and maintenance services for substations, transmission line and pressure reducing & measuring stations. At Paras Energy, we believe that electricity should be accessible and affordable to all. Over the years, we have gathered a diverse clientele all over Nigeria and we continue to grow our portfolio through the provision of reliable services. On 8th April 2016, Paras Energy became the 27th Company to supply power to National Grid in Nigeria and the first privately owned company to supply power under a bilateral agreement to their customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: MIS Executive (Procurement)

Job Location: Ogijo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Data Analysis & Reporting: Generating reports on purchasing patterns, vendor performance, and inventory levels to identify cost-saving opportunities.
	System Management: Utilizing ERP systems, Excel, Power BI or specialized procurement software to maintain accurate databases for purchasing transactions, invoices, and supplier data.
	Forecasting: Analyzing past data to predict future procurement needs and workload, assisting with budget preparation.
	Performance Monitoring: Tracking key metrics like cost savings, supplier reliability, and cycle times.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree
	Experience: 4–5+ years in procurement, supply chain, or data management roles.
	Technical Skills: Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP) and ERP software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Navision, NetSuite).
	Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets to make informed decisions and identify trends.
	Attention to Detail: High accuracy in data entry and reporting.
	Soft Skills: Strong communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.


Method of Application

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Officer (FCC Project)",
  "description": "The Centre for Communication and Social Impact (CCSI) is a leading Social and Behavior Change (SBC) organization with expertise in utilizing evidence from research to implement effective strategies that address barriers preventing designated audiences from adopting recommended behaviors. Registered in 2001 as a Non-Governmental and Not for Profit Organization with the Corporate Affairs Commission of Nigeria, CCSI continues to work towards being the center of excellence in strategic communications in Africa. Driven by values of integrity, passion, care, innovation, and excellence, CCSI focuses on the central role of strategic communication to impact behaviors, build brands, and provide technical leadership in health and social development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Social Media Officer (FCC Project)

Job Locations:&nbsp;Kaduna and Kano
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description


	The Social Media Officer will report to the Media and Programmes Officer, with a dotted-line technical reporting relationship to the FCC SBC Advisor, and will receive support from the Knowledge Management Department as required.
	About the Project -&nbsp;The Family Planning/Childbirth Spacing Investment component of the Faith and Cultural Champions (FCC) Project advances voluntary childbirth spacing outcomes in Kaduna and Kano states by leveraging trusted faith leaders and cultural institutions.
	The initiative is designed to bridge the gap between social norms and health-seeking behaviors to create supportive environment for the uptake of modern childbirth spacing methods. Position Summary
	The Social Media Officer will lead the day-to-day management of the FCC project&rsquo;s digital presence across the project&rsquo;s social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, X (Twitter), YouTube, LinkedIn, and the website.
	The role will work closely with the creative team and programme teams to source, develop, package, and publish high-quality digital content that strengthens the visibility, credibility, and public understanding of the FCC project&rsquo;s work impact.
